Q1.ques: Which among the following cannot be used in the case of stream ciphers ?

Q2.ques: A stream cipher key is usually of size ___ or 128 bits.

Q3.ques: Which among the following has the lowest bitrate ?

Q4.ques: RC4 was built on the sole purpose of generating random bits i.e. to act as a PRNG.

Q5.a: a test to determine whether the number of runs of ones and zeros of various lengths is as expected
Q5.b: a test to detect if a sequence can be significantly compressed without loss of information
Q5.c: a test to determine whether the number of ones and zeros in a sequence is approx the same as in a truly random o/p
Q5.d: a test for the check of evenness in the 1s and 0s

Q6.ques: We should not be able to determine the seed from any previous knowledge of the bits sequence. This is the property of backward unpredictability.

Q7.ques: Forward Unpredictability is a property when the seed is unknown, and the next output bit is the sequence should be unpredictable.

Q8.ques: A rule to check for a large number N being a prime number
Q8.a: by dividing N by every even integer less than N/2
Q8.b: by dividing N by every odd integer less than root(N)
Q8.c: by dividing N by every even integer less than root(N)
Q8.d: by dividing N by every integer less than N/2
